title: Overall
stimulusHtml:
The thesis may be a “diplomatic” thesis, a “military thesis, or a combination of both:

  • A diplomatic thesis would agree with the statement, although the emphasis it places on intimidation, on control and on the danger from the Soviet Union may vary from essay to essay.

  • A military thesis would disagree with the statement and stress the desire to force Japan’s unconditional surrender to save American lives.

  • A combination thesis would argue for a combination of diplomatic and military reasons.

13-15: Develops a clear thesis that evaluates the statement; makes thorough use of the documents; confronts conflicting diplomatic and military evidence effectively; uses appropriate and significant outside information; is well written.

10-12: Supports a clear thesis; uses most documents; deals with conflicting diplomatic and military evidence; contains some outside information; is well written; may contain minor errors of fact.

7-9: States a clear thesis; uses several documents; may acknowledge conflicting diplomatic and military evidence; has minimal or scattered outside information; may contain some errors of fact.

4-6: Has weak thesis; restates, rephrases, or minimally uses documents; misuses or lacks relevant outside information; may contain major errors.

1-3: Has weak thesis or no thesis; makes minimal or no use of documents; may be poorly written; may contain major errors.
